intro: Gymnotrix uniseta, commonly known as the single-setted gymnotrix, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gymnotrix uniseta is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
